security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No code execution, no network calls, no file system access, no external commands. This skill provides only cloud architecture guidance and best practices.

content.user_title: Design cloud architecture across AWS, Azure, and GCP
content.value_statement: Building cloud infrastructure requires understanding complex patterns across multiple platforms. This skill provides expert guidance on architecture design, Infrastructure as Code implementation, cost optimization strategies, and production deployment patterns for AWS, Azure, and GCP.
actual_capabilities: Design multi-cloud architecture patterns for AWS, Azure, and GCP
Implement Infrastructure as Code with Terraform best practices
Optimize cloud costs using reserved instances, spot instances, and right-sizing
Configure high availability and multi-region deployments
Apply cloud security patterns including IAM, encryption, and network isolation
Set up monitoring, alerting, and observability for cloud workloads
limitations: Does not execute infrastructure deployments or modify cloud resources
Does not provide real-time cost analysis or access billing data
Does not integrate with cloud provider APIs for status checks
Does not generate or apply Terraform configuration files directly

use_cases.title: Design production cloud architecture
use_cases.description: Plan multi-tier applications with proper compute, storage, database, and networking patterns across cloud providers.

use_cases.title: Implement Infrastructure as Code
use_cases.description: Structure Terraform projects with modular design, remote state management, and environment isolation.

use_cases.title: Optimize cloud costs and reliability
use_cases.description: Reduce spending through reserved capacity, spot instances, and right-sizing while maintaining high availability.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a cloud architecture for a [application type] with [requirements] requirements. Include compute, storage, database, and networking patterns for [AWS/Azure/GCP/multi-cloud].

prompt_templates.title: Terraform Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Terraform project structure for a [environment] environment. Include modules for networking, compute, and database with best practices for state management and module versioning.

prompt_templates.title: Cost Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze and optimize cloud costs for a [service type] workload. Identify opportunities using reserved instances, spot capacity, storage lifecycle policies, and resource right-sizing.

prompt_templates.title: HA Configuration
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a high availability deployment across multiple availability zones and regions for a [workload type]. Include load balancing, database replication, automatic failover, and disaster recovery procedures.

output_examples.input: Design a microservices architecture on AWS for a high-traffic e-commerce application requiring 99.99% uptime
output: Compute: Use EKS for container orchestration with auto-scaling based on CPU and request metrics
Storage: S3 for product images with CloudFront CDN, EBSgp3 for application data
Database: Aurora PostgreSQL with multi-AZ replica and auto-failover enabled
Caching: ElastiCache Redis for session storage and frequently accessed data
Networking: Private subnets for backend services, Application Load Balancer for traffic distribution
Security: IAM roles for service-to-service authentication, Secrets Manager for credentials
HA: Deploy across 3 AZs with health checks and automatic failover within 60 seconds

best_practices: Use Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation) for all resources to enable reproducible deployments
Implement defense in depth with security groups, private subnets, and least-privilege IAM policies
Separate environments (dev, staging, prod) with isolated state and access controls
anti_patterns: Using long-term credentials instead of IAM roles for service authentication
Deploying production workloads to a single availability zone
Hardcoding values instead of using variables and Terraform workspaces

faq.question: Does this skill work with all cloud providers?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill covers AWS, Azure, and GCP with specific service mappings and equivalent patterns for each platform.

faq.question: What are the cost optimization limits?
faq.answer: The skill provides strategies but does not access billing APIs. Real-time analysis requires integration with cloud cost management tools.

faq.question: Can this skill generate Terraform code?
faq.answer: The skill provides patterns and best practices. It does not generate executable Terraform configuration files.

faq.question: Is my cloud data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill. It reads only the conversation context and generates text. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why are my Terraform deployments failing?
faq.answer: Common issues include state lock conflicts, provider version mismatches, and insufficient IAM permissions. Check error messages and state file integrity.

faq.question: How does this compare to cloud-native tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides architectural guidance. Cloud-native tools like AWS CDK or Pulumi generate infrastructure code. Use both together for best results.
